title: NBA players cryptic emojis driving people crazy
text:

Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs NBA players cryptic emojis driving people crazy Alysha Tsuji , USA TODAY 12:05 a.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 
(Photo: David Butler II-USA TODAY Sports) 
The NBA trade deadline is Thursday, Feb. 23, at 3 p.m. ET, and with all the wild things that have happened over the summer with, for example, Kevin Durant joining the Warriors , and in the past week, with DeMarcus Cousins being suddenly traded to the Pelicans after the All-Star Game, it truly feels like anything could happen. 
From fans to media, the NBA world is on edge, waiting for the next huge piece of news to break and looking for any clues. 
Now that emojis exist, players are able to express how they feel - or just completely troll us all - without really saying anything. This trend truly first started in the summer of 2015 when the DeAndre Jordan signing race resulted in an epic emoji battle . In the year of 2017, it's gotten even more out of hand. 
Here's a collection of cryptic tweets from the past couple days, and some fun reactions: 1. Pistons Center Andre Drummond's Alien ðŸ‘½ â€” Andre Drummond (@AndreDrummond) February 23, 2017 WHAT DOES IT MEAN?
